div.div: WARNING: THIS WILL MAKE YOU FEEL FAT

Obstacle courses are the biggest thing in adventure sports, with millions of amped-up Americans charging into the slop—and a cadre of cutthroat entrepreneurs cashing in. No one is profiting more than Tough Mudder creator Will Dean, a polished Englishman and Harvard Business School grad who will stop at nothing to sell you his brand of suffering.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OWljPv&via=Digg&text=Playing Dirty

div.div: ObViOuSlY LiKe ThIs

div.a: How To Use Caps Lock The RIGHT Way

div.div: Caps locking is for CHUMPS.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RQB3Ry&via=Digg&text=How To Use Caps Lock The RIGHT Way

div.div: GALACTIC EMISSIONS

div.a: This 2-Million-Light-Year-Long Galactic Emission Looks Like An Afterburner

div.div: An extended jet of cosmic material traveling near the speed of light emerges from a distant galaxy, looking quite similar to the afterburner pattern of a jet engine on Earth.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UtoZe3&via=Digg&text=This 2-Million-Light-Year-Long Galactic Emission Looks Like An Afterburner

div.div: APPLE V. SAMSUNG

div.a: Samsung May End LCD Screen Deal With Apple

div.div: Samsung Display was once Apple's top panel supplier, but shipments have fallen drastically over the past year.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RQmmhj&via=Digg&text=Samsung May End LCD Screen Deal With Apple

div.div: FICTITIOUS JOB OPENINGS

div.a: Daily Planet Seeks Reporter After Clark Kent Quits

div.div: In Superman issue 13, the Man of Steel's alter ego, mild-mannered reporter Clark Kent, quits the Metropolis newspaper that has been his employer since the DC Comics superhero's earliest days in 1940.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RPjtgQ&via=Digg&text=Daily Planet Seeks Reporter After Clark Kent Quits

div.div: GET A REAL JOB

div.a: What Obama And Romney Would Sound Like Interviewing For A Real Job

div.div: Why do we have presidential debates if the answers are so absurdly vague they’d get the candidates laughed out of a real job interview?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RgW1tS&via=Digg&text=What Obama And Romney Would Sound Like Interviewing For A Real Job

div.div: CRIMINAL MINDS

div.a: How The Killer Who Inspired 'Silence of the Lambs' Helped A Psychologist

div.div: Jack Apsche is one of the few people in history happy to have crossed paths with a serial killer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XHLFpG&via=Digg&text=How The Killer Who Inspired 'Silence of the Lambs' Helped A Psychologist

div.div: QUAKE DAMAGED THE SCALE OF JUSTICE

div.a: Scientists Get 6 Years In Prison For Not Predicting Earthquake

div.div: Six Italian scientists and a government official have been sentenced to six years in prison over statements they made prior to a 2009 earthquake that killed 309 in the town of L'Aquila.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UsBAhE&via=Digg&text=Scientists Get 6 Years In Prison For Not Predicting Earthquake

div.div: WHAT ABOUT ROMAN POLANSKI?

div.a: Would You Buy A Product Endorsed By Lance Armstrong?

div.div: It's much easier for consumers to justify continued support of a celebrity or politician disgraced by scandal when they separate moral judgments about a public figure from assessments of their professional performance, according to a new study.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QO8TFL&via=Digg&text=Would You Buy A Product Endorsed By Lance Armstrong?

div.div: MAN 2.0

div.a: Will The Singularity Turn Us Into Gods Or End The Human Race?

div.div: A gathering of experts on artificial intelligence becomes a search for deeper meaning.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RR5GWH&via=Digg&text=Will The Singularity Turn Us Into Gods Or End The Human Race?

div.div: THE FACTS OF LIFE

div.a: Economists Say 'Revenge Of The Nerds' Is A Lie

div.div: A new study says those popular kids, like that no-good prom king who may or may not have made your high school life awful, will actually out-earn you because they're so freaking likable.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TsT6T3&via=Digg&text=Economists Say 'Revenge Of The Nerds' Is A Lie

div.div: 'WHAT ARE YOUR CRIMES?'

div.a: Thinking About Applying To Scientology's Sea Org? Here's A Peek At The Application

div.div: A Scientology tipster briefly considered joining Sea Org, but balked upon seeing the application. Take a look for yourself.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SdB1FK&via=Digg&text=Thinking About Applying To Scientology's Sea Org? Here's A Peek At The Application

div.div: SPECIAL SAUCE

div.a: Why Does Eating Hot Chilies Make Your Nose Run?

div.div: If you’ve ever bitten into a raw habanero, eaten a dish laced with Scotch Bonnets, or skinned a basket of roasted New Mexico green chilies, you’re familiar with a roster of physiological effects.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QBzyaY&via=Digg&text=Why Does Eating Hot Chilies Make Your Nose Run?

div.div: FIND YOURSELF A NICE BIKER
The vice president gave a little dating advice to a fireman and his pre-teen daughter.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RRyJcI&via=Digg&text=Joe Biden’s Dating Advice

div.div: HANDLE WITH CARE

div.a: Yes, Laser Pointers Can Land You In Jail

div.div: Laser pointers are no joke, and neither is shining them at planes. You may recall that the FBI recently set up a national laser attack task force, and they aren't kidding around. One laser-happy moron just got sentenced to 18 months in prison.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RMWQtt&via=Digg&text=Yes, Laser Pointers Can Land You In Jail

div.div: LINDA ELLERBEE IS IN THE TANK

div.a: Obama Wins By A Landslide... Among Kids

div.div: It's a landslide for President Barack Obama — at least among people too young to vote.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TCWyVi&via=Digg&text=Obama Wins By A Landslide... Among Kids

div.div: CLOUD NEIN

div.a: Amazon Cloud Goes Down Again, Breaks Foursquare And Others

div.div: The cloud is cool. But it’s not always there.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TCYqxs&via=Digg&text=Amazon Cloud Goes Down Again, Breaks Foursquare And Others

div.div: INSTAGRAM UNICORN

div.a: Proper Terms For 'Gurus' On Every Social Media Site

div.div: It’s really embarrassing to see social media experts running around with the wrong fake-cool job titles, all calling themselves “Facebook ninjas” and “Twitter rockstars”. Let’s clarify what title you need based on what site you have "expertise" in.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QBxUWQ&via=Digg&text=Proper Terms For 'Gurus' On Every Social Media Site

div.div: BUT STILL TOTALLY EXTREME

div.a: Monster Energy May Actually Kill You

div.div: Five people may have died over the past three years after drinking Monster Energy, a popular energy drink that is high in caffeine, according to incident reports recently released by the Food and Drug Administration.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XLsQCj&via=Digg&text=Monster Energy May Actually Kill You

div.div: R.I.P. RIM

div.a: Even Federal Agencies Are Dropping BlackBerry Now

div.div: The Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency said it will end its contract with BlackBerry maker Research In Motion in favor of Apple's iPhone, dealing a new blow to RIM just months before it launches a vital new device.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TN3TC9&via=Digg&text=Even Federal Agencies Are Dropping BlackBerry Now

div.div: WHAT'S A STREAM WORTH?

div.a: Why No One Knows How Much Money Musicians Are Making Now

div.div: In the digital music era, complicated and outdated copyright law as well as private negotiations have made it difficult see how much is really going back to the people making music.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Se2pU6&via=Digg&text=Why No One Knows How Much Money Musicians Are Making Now

div.div: LIFE IN THE FAST LANE

div.a: Cellular Data Reveals How Pace Of Life Accelerates In Cities

div.div: You don't have to spend long in a metropolis like New York, London or Tokyo to sense the dramatic pace at which the locals live their lives. But up until now, just how much faster city life moves was hard to quantify.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XJiSBl&via=Digg&text=Cellular Data Reveals How Pace Of Life Accelerates In Cities

div.div: DREAM JOBS

div.a: The Life Of A Superyacht Chef

div.div: It's a grueling job, but somebody's got to do it.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TsmXLv&via=Digg&text=The Life Of A Superyacht Chef
